Prompt:
Example 1:
Daniel was but eight years old, a boy of striking appearance, with black hair and eyes, and a swarthy complexion. He was of slender frame, and his large dark eyes, deep set beneath an overhanging brow, gave a singular appearance to the thin face of the delicate looking boy. He was a farmer's son, and lived in a plain, old-fashioned house, shaded by fine elms, and separated from the broad, quiet street by a fence. It was situated in a valley, at the bend of the Merrimac, on both sides of which rose high hills, which the boy climbed many a time for the more extended view they commanded. From a high sheep-pasture on his father's farm, through a wide opening in the hills, he could see on a clear day Brentney Mountain in Vermont, and in a different direction the snowy top of Mount Washington, far away to the northeast.

Example 2:
There is no specific scientific calculator prescribed for this subject. Any scientific, nonprogrammable calculator is suitable for your studies. Different scientific calculators have different functions and it is up to you to know your calculator. Most scientific calculators have algebraic logic; the operation in an expression can be entered in the calculator in the order in which the expression is read (left to right). The calculator automatically follows the conventional order of operations. 
You can setup your calculator to work either in natural display or linear display. Natural display causes fractions, irrational numbers, expressions, and certain functions to be displayed as you see them on paper. Linear display causes fractions and other expressions to be displayed in a line. 
When we come across an expression such as 7 + 3 ÷ 10 × 1, it makes a difference how we choose which operations to perform first.
Scientific calculators have been programmed to follow preset mathematical rules. If we press the buttons in a certain order, the calculator does the operations according to the rules that it has been programmed with.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'computer security' targeting the same readability level (High School), limited to 200 words. A computer security system, a type of firewall, guards a network's data. It can be set up to work in two ways: a "blacklist" or a "whitelist". A blacklist lists all the things the firewall is supposed to block, while a whitelist lists all the things it is supposed to allow. Most firewalls use a combination of both lists to determine what traffic to block or allow. Different firewalls have different features, and it is up to the network administrator to know their system. Some firewalls have rules for how to handle certain types of traffic, such as blocking all traffic from a certain IP address. Others have rules for how to handle certain types of data, such as blocking all files with a certain extension. It makes a difference how we choose which rules to apply first, and how the system is set up to follow them.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'computer security' targeting the same readability level (High School), limited to 200 words. 
In the world of computer security, complex algorithms are used to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive information. A skilled hacker, however, can exploit vulnerabilities in a system's code to bypass these measures. Most computer systems have built-in security protocols, such as firewalls and encryption software, which can be configured to follow specific rules. When it comes to handling expressions, such as a user's login credentials, it makes a difference how we choose which security measures to implement first. Computer security experts have developed various methods to prevent hacking, including secure coding practices and intrusion detection systems. These measures can be used to protect sensitive information from being accessed by unauthorized users. A secure computer system is one that has been programmed to follow preset security rules, and can automatically detect and prevent potential threats. By following established protocols and using the right tools, computer security professionals can ensure the integrity of sensitive information and protect against cyber threats. 

(Note: The two examples are from "The Scarlet Letter" and "College Algebra" respectively

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'computer security' targeting the same readability level (High School), limited to 200 words. 

In the realm of computer security, there are various types of threats that exist, each with its own unique characteristics and methods of operation. One such threat is the malware, which can take the form of viruses, worms, or trojans. These malicious programs can compromise the security of a computer system, allowing unauthorized access to sensitive information. In order to protect against such threats, it is essential to have a robust firewall in place, as well as up-to-date antivirus software. The firewall acts as a barrier between the computer and the outside world, preventing unauthorized access, while the antivirus software scans for and detects malicious programs. It is also crucial to use strong passwords and to keep the operating system and other software up-to-date, as vulnerabilities can be exploited by malicious individuals. By taking these precautions, individuals can significantly reduce the risk of their computer systems being compromised. In this way, they can safeguard their sensitive information and maintain the security of their computer systems. 

Note: The paragraph is written

A computer's security is of the utmost importance to protect against cyber threats. The security features of a computer are designed to follow preset rules, like a calculator, to safeguard against malicious software, viruses, and other online dangers. A firewall, like a high hill, separates the computer from potential threats, while an antivirus program, like a guardian, scans for and removes viruses. To keep a computer safe, it is crucial to be cautious when clicking on links or downloading files, just as Daniel was careful when climbing the hills around his farm to avoid hidden dangers. By following these guidelines, a computer can be protected from cyber threats and stay secure. Security software protects computer systems from unauthorized access, misuse, or damage. There is no specific security software prescribed for this subject. Any reputable security software is suitable for your studies. Different security software has different features and it is up to you to know your software. Most security software has real-time monitoring; the activity in your system can be monitored in real-time. The software automatically follows conventional security protocols. 
You can set up your security software to work either in automatic mode or custom mode. Automatic mode causes the software to scan and update itself on a regular basis. Custom mode causes you to choose when to scan and update. 
When we come across a system vulnerability such as a virus or malware, it makes a difference how we choose which actions to take first. 
Computer security software has been programmed to follow preset security rules. If we configure the software in a certain order, the software does the security tasks according to the rules that it has been programmed with. Understanding these rules is essential to

It was situated in a valley, at the bend of the Merrimac, on both sides of which rose high hills, which the boy climbed many a time for the more extended view they commanded. From a high sheep-pasture on his father's farm, through a wide opening in the hills, he could see on a clear day Brentney Mountain in Vermont, and in a different direction the snowy top of Mount Washington, far away to the northeast.

Example 2:
There is no specific scientific calculator prescribed for this subject. Any scientific, nonprogrammable calculator is suitable for your studies. Different scientific calculators have different functions and it is up to you to know your calculator. Most scientific calculators have algebraic logic; the operation in an expression can be entered in the calculator in the order in which the expression is read (left to right). The calculator automatically follows the conventional order of operations. 
You can setup your calculator to work either in natural display or linear display. Natural display causes fractions, irrational numbers, expressions, and certain functions to be displayed as you see them on paper. Linear display causes fractions and other expressions to be displayed in a line. 
When we come across an expression such as 7 + 3 ÷ 10 × 1, it makes a difference how we choose which operations to perform first.
Scientific calculators have been programmed to follow preset mathematical rules. If we press the buttons in a certain order, the calculator does the operations according to the rules that it has been programmed with.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'computer security' targeting the same readability level (High School), limited to 200 words. 

Computer security involves protecting computer systems from various types of threats, including unauthorized access, data breaches, and malware attacks. Like a farmer's son who protects his family's farm from wild animals, a computer user must be vigilant in safeguarding their digital assets. A strong password, a reliable firewall, and regular software updates are essential tools in maintaining computer security. Just as a high vantage point on a hill allows a boy to see the surrounding landscape, a computer user can gain a broader view of their system's security by regularly monitoring system logs and network traffic. This can help identify potential vulnerabilities and prevent attacks before they occur. By following established security protocols and staying informed about emerging threats, a computer user can ensure the safety and integrity of their digital world. Like Brentney Mountain in Vermont, a strong and stable computer system is a valuable resource that requires constant care and attention. 

Note: The paragraph structure, vocabulary and sentence length are based on the given examples and written for a high school level

There is no specific software prescribed for this subject. Any computer with a secure internet connection is suitable for your studies. Different computers have different features and it is up to you to know your operating system. Most computers have firewalls; the protection in an online session can be entered in the computer in the way that it is configured (by setting up rules and permissions). The computer automatically follows the conventional security protocols. 
You can setup your computer to work either in safe mode or normal mode. Safe mode causes suspicious activity and certain applications to be displayed in a line, and the computer will not allow them to run. Normal mode causes all applications to be displayed as they appear on screen, and the computer will allow them to run.

Using vocabulary and structure from examples, write a short paragraph about 'computer security' targeting the same readability level (High School), limited to 200 words. 
There is no specific security software prescribed for this subject. Any anti-virus, firewall, and anti-spyware software is suitable for your studies. Different security software has different features and it is up to you to know your software. Most security software has a user-friendly interface; the options and settings can be accessed in the order in which they are presented (top to bottom). The software automatically follows the conventional protocols. You can setup your software to work either in normal mode or safe mode. Normal mode allows you to access the internet and other online resources, while safe mode restricts your access for added security. When we come across a suspicious email or link, it makes a difference how we choose to handle it. Security software has been programmed to detect and prevent malicious activity. If we install the software and configure it correctly, the software does the security operations according to the rules that it has been programmed with. By taking these precautions, you can protect your computer and sensitive information from online threats
